page.title: 17OVER WYRESDALE:LIFESTYLE
page.content: Most of the owner occupied houses are on mains water linked to the Thirlmere - Manchester pipeline but nearly all the Estate farms use their own spring water. Everyone has electricity but there is no gas. Most cooking is done by electricity though there are some 'Aga style' cookers which may run on oil. There are just a few microwave ovens but most people have freezers. All families have washing machines and some have dishwashers. Most people have access to a car for shopping and much is done in Lancaster or at the Post Office in Dolphinholme, where pensions are collected with the help neighbours. Two travelling shops visit twice weekly - a baker and a butcher who carries a variety of other goods. The library van visits the area and there is a police station here but no doctor's surgery nearer than Galgate.
